section.name: Introduction
section.p: jDTAUS Core provides a common application programming interface for jDTAUS integration. It is split into various artifacts providing flexible integration facilities. The Core API artifact provides interfaces to core application services like task monitoring or modular implementation management. The Core Utilities artifact provides core utility implementations which may be of interest when implementing core interfaces.

As with all jDTAUS API artifacts the corresponding application runtime needs to be assembled manually. Whenever the Core API artifact is used at compile time (whether pulled in transitively by e.g. the Core Utilities artifact or requested), the application assembler needs to provide additional runtime artifacts (see below) for proper operation.

subsection.name: Container Implementations
subsection.p: The client container implementation provides the jDTAUS Container reference implementation and implements a runtime suitable for single-session standalone applications. The servlet container implementation extends that runtime adding support for multi-session web environments and is only needed for integration with web applications.
Note: Web applications must be configured manually to work with jDTAUS correctly. See ServletFilter.

subsection.name: Logging Implementations
subsection.p: Three logging implementations to choose from. JDK 1.4, Log4J or Commons logging.

subsection.name: Task Monitoring Implementations
subsection.p: See the TaskEventSource reference implementation artifact.

subsection.name: Runtime Environment Implementations
subsection.p: See the Runtime reference implementation artifact and the ExceptionEventSource reference implementation artifact.

subsection.name: Implementation programming interfaces
subsection.p: The Core SPI artifact provides interfaces to be used by implementations to expose core application services to applications and is shared by all runtime artifacts at compile time.

subsection.name: Maven 2 Repository
subsection.p: As of April, 2007 all jDTAUS artifacts are provided via the central Maven 2 repository in group org.jdtaus.
